ai_summary: Add optional tags field to Pomodoro sessions and time-tracking entries for activity categorization and analytics
notes: Feature request to allow users to categorize Pomodoro and time-tracking sessions with optional tags (e.g., #learning, #writing). The codebase is well-positioned for this: (1) Task tags infrastructure already exists with array storage in frontmatter, (2) TimeEntry already has a description field that could be extended, (3) TimeTrackingController.getTimeSummary() already aggregates statistics by tags - this pattern can be applied to Pomodoro, (4) PomodoroSession and PomodoroSessionHistory interfaces can easily be extended with optional tags array, (5) FieldMapping system supports custom field names for daily note storage, (6) Multiple storage backends supported (plugin data + daily notes). Implementation follows existing patterns in the codebase.
suggested_fix: 1. Extend PomodoroSession and PomodoroSessionHistory interfaces in types.ts with optional 'tags?: string[]' and 'description?: string' fields. 2. Update PomodoroService.startPomodoro() to accept optional tags parameter. 3. Add tag input UI to PomodoroView near task selection (token-style selector or input field). 4. Extend PomodoroController API endpoints to accept/return tags. 5. Update PomodoroStatsView to show tag-based analytics using the existing pattern from TimeTrackingController.getTimeSummary(). 6. Similarly extend TimeEntry with tags array (beyond current single description). 7. Add FieldMapping entry 'pomodoroTags' for daily note storage. All changes should be backward compatible with existing sessions.
